thread.title: 5th suspect arrested in connection to deadly Albany shooting
thread.title_full: 5th suspect arrested in connection to deadly Albany shooting

author: @walbnews10
title: 5th suspect arrested in connection to deadly Albany shooting
text:
ALBANY, Ga. (WALB) - A man involved in an Albany shooting that left one person dead and another injured has been arrested.
The fatal shooting happened on March 6 in the 1000 block of Radium Springs Road. According to APD, Malik Frazier, 24, was involved in the shooting death of Markel Harper, 29, who died after being shot in the chest, and left a 28-year-old with injuries.
The latest development came on Wednesday, April 24, when the Ben Hill County Sheriff’s Office informed the Albany Police Department investigators of the arrest of Frazier in their area.
Frazier was taken back to Dougherty County and is facing charges of murder and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. A total of five suspects are now arrested in connection to the shooting.
If anyone has any information regarding this incident, please contact the Albany Police Department at (229) 431-2100.
Our previous coverage:
NEW DETAILS: 1 dead, another injured in late night Albany shooting (walb.com) 16-year-old, 2 others charged in connection to fatal Albany shooting (walb.com) Fourth suspect charged in connection to deadly Albany shooting (walb.com) 5th suspect wanted in connection to deadly Radium Springs Rd. shooting (walb.com) Have a news tip or see an error that needs correction? Let us know. Please include the article’s headline in your message.
